hypothesis_content.title: Market Maker Liquidity Provision Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: Following announcements of market maker liquidity boosts (like Crypto.com's recent announcement), when spreads tighten by >15% on major pairs within 2 hours, the initial price movement will reverse 40% within the next 3 hours as liquidity provision creates temporary artificial momentum.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers adding liquidity often create temporary momentum as they fill order books, but this doesn't reflect organic demand. Recent Crypto.com news shows this dynamic. Neutral regime lacks follow-through for sustained moves from technical liquidity changes.
entry_conditions: Market maker liquidity announcement within past 24h
BTC-USD spread tightens >15% on 3+ major exchanges
Price moves >0.5% in direction of initial announcement reaction
Entry when 30-minute RSI crosses 70 (if up move) or 30 (if down move)
Volume begins declining from announcement spike

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues beyond announcement extreme by 0.4%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Reversal rate <60% over 15 events or average reversal <30%
